categories.description: Zoloft (sertraline) is one of the most commonly prescribed SSRI antidepressants.
Not a painter, though the name sounds vaguely artistic.
Lexapro (escitalopram) is an SSRI antidepressant used for anxiety and depression.
Not a tech product, though it sounds like it could be a SaaS platform.
Prozac (fluoxetine) was the first SSRI antidepressant, approved in 1987.
Wellbutrin (bupropion) is an atypical antidepressant that works differently from SSRIs.
Cymbalta (duloxetine) is an SNRI antidepressant also used for chronic pain.
Effexor (venlafaxine) is an SNRI antidepressant used for depression and anxiety disorders.
Celexa (citalopram) is an SSRI antidepressant used for depression.
Paxil (paroxetine) is an SSRI antidepressant used for depression and anxiety disorders.
Pristiq (desvenlafaxine) is an SNRI antidepressant, the active metabolite of Effexor.
Remeron (mirtazapine) is a tetracyclic antidepressant that also helps with sleep.
Trintellix (vortioxetine) is an antidepressant with a multimodal mechanism of action.
Trazodone is an antidepressant often prescribed off-label for insomnia.
Abilify (aripiprazole) is an atypical antipsychotic used to augment antidepressant treatment.
Seroquel (quetiapine) is an atypical antipsychotic used for bipolar disorder and depression.
Latuda (lurasidone) is an atypical antipsychotic used for bipolar depression and schizophrenia.
Vraylar (cariprazine) is an atypical antipsychotic for bipolar disorder and schizophrenia.
Rexulti (brexpiprazole) is an atypical antipsychotic used to augment antidepressant treatment.
Viibryd (vilazodone) is an SSRI antidepressant with partial 5-HT1A agonist activity.
Geodon (ziprasidone) is an atypical antipsychotic used for schizophrenia and bipolar disorder.
Lunesta (eszopiclone) is a sedative-hypnotic medication prescribed for insomnia.
Zyprexa (olanzapine) is an atypical antipsychotic used for schizophrenia and bipolar disorder.
Klonopin (clonazepam) is a benzodiazepine used for anxiety and seizure disorders.
Thorazine (chlorpromazine) was the first major antipsychotic medication, approved in 1954.
Risperdal (risperidone) is an atypical antipsychotic used for schizophrenia and bipolar disorder.
Nardil (phenelzine) is an MAOI antidepressant requiring dietary restrictions.
Lamictal (lamotrigine) is a mood stabilizer used for bipolar disorder and epilepsy.
Invega (paliperidone) is an extended-release atypical antipsychotic for schizophrenia.
Pablo Picasso was the legendary Spanish painter who co-founded Cubism and created over 50,000 artworks including Guernica.
Not a philosopher, though he revolutionized how we see form and perspective.
Andy Warhol was the pop art icon behind Campbell's Soup Cans and the iconic Marilyn Monroe prints.
He wrote books, but he's definitively known as an artist, not an author.
Salvador Dalí was the surrealist master known for The Persistence of Memory with its melting clocks.
DALL-E is OpenAI's image generation AI named after the surrealist painter.
Leonardo da Vinci was the ultimate Renaissance polymath - Mona Lisa, Last Supper, flying machines.
Leonardo.AI is an AI image generation platform named after the master artist.
Leonardo appears in AC II and Brotherhood as Ezio's friend who builds his gadgets.
Michelangelo was the Italian Renaissance sculptor of David and painter of the Sistine Chapel ceiling.
Not a philosopher, though he certainly had opinions (mostly complaints about Pope Julius II).
Raphael was the Italian Renaissance master painter of the School of Athens.
Not a celestial body, though his name means 'God has healed' in Hebrew.
Rembrandt van Rijn was the Dutch Golden Age master of light and shadow, famous for The Night Watch and over 90 self-portraits.
Asteroid 4511 Rembrandt and a crater on Mercury are named after the Dutch painter.
Claude Monet was the founder of French Impressionism, famous for his Water Lilies series and Impression, Sunrise.
Asteroid 6676 Monet is named after the French Impressionist painter.
Wassily Kandinsky pioneered abstract art with works like Composition VIII.
Kandinsky is Sberbank's AI image generation model named after the abstract art pioneer.
Jackson Pollock was the abstract expressionist famous for drip painting technique.
Banksy is the anonymous British street artist known for politically subversive works like Girl with Balloon.
Not a painter - Auguste Rodin was primarily a sculptor, known for The Thinker and The Kiss.
Francisco Goya was the Spanish painter known for his dark period works like Saturn Devouring His Son.
Asteroid 6592 Goya is named after the Spanish painter Francisco Goya.
Jean-Michel Basquiat was the neo-expressionist artist who rose from graffiti to become one of the most celebrated painters of the 1980s.
M.C. Escher created mathematically inspired impossible architecture art like Ascending and Descending.
Escher's impossible geometry and recursive patterns are hugely influential in computer graphics and digital art.
Gustav Klimt was the Austrian symbolist painter known for 'The Kiss' with his signature gold leaf technique.
Johannes Vermeer was the Dutch Golden Age painter of 'Girl with a Pearl Earring'.
Asteroid 9928 Vermeer is named after the Dutch Golden Age painter.
Caravaggio was the Italian Baroque master known for dramatic chiaroscuro lighting and violent subject matter.
Asteroid 10605 Caravaggio is named after the Italian Baroque painter.
Edgar Degas was the French Impressionist famous for paintings of ballet dancers.
Bernini was primarily a sculptor, but he did paint - just far less famously than his sculptures like Ecstasy of Saint Teresa.
Blaise Pascal was a 17th-century philosopher and mathematician known for Pascal's Wager.
Pascal is a structured programming language designed by Niklaus Wirth in 1970.
He wrote philosophical works but is primarily known as a mathematician/philosopher, not an author.
Thales of Miletus was the first Greek philosopher, predicting a solar eclipse in 585 BCE.
Thales Group is a major French multinational in defense, aerospace, and cybersecurity.
Francis Bacon was the father of empiricism and the scientific method.
Bacon.js is a functional reactive programming library for JavaScript.
Not the philosopher - Francis Bacon (1909-1992) was a different person, an Irish figurative painter.
Franz Kafka was the existentialist author of 'The Metamorphosis' and 'The Trial'.
Apache Kafka is a distributed event streaming platform used by thousands of companies.
Ernest Hemingway was the American novelist known for sparse prose in 'The Old Man and the Sea' and 'A Farewell to Arms'.
Hemingway Editor is a popular writing app that highlights complex sentences and passive voice.
Isaac Asimov was the legendary sci-fi author of the Foundation series and I, Robot.
Asimov Institute creates neural network architecture diagrams and focuses on AI research visualization.
Socrates was the ancient Greek philosopher who developed the Socratic method of questioning.
Socrates is a major character in Assassin's Creed Odyssey, wandering Athens and dispensing wisdom.
Socrates famously never wrote anything down - we know him through Plato's writings.
Plato was the ancient Greek philosopher who founded the Academy and developed the Theory of Forms.
Plato appears in Assassin's Creed Odyssey as a student of Socrates.
Plato wrote The Republic and numerous Socratic dialogues that shaped Western philosophy.
Aristotle was the ancient Greek philosopher who tutored Alexander the Great and wrote on everything from ethics to biology.
Aristotle is an AI knowledge management company focused on enterprise solutions.
Aristotle appears in Assassin's Creed Odyssey as tutor to Alexander the Great.
René Descartes was the rationalist philosopher famous for 'I think, therefore I am'.
Descartes wrote Meditations on First Philosophy and Discourse on the Method.
Friedrich Nietzsche declared 'God is dead' and introduced concepts like the Übermensch.
Nietzsche wrote Thus Spoke Zarathustra and Beyond Good and Evil.
Immanuel Kant developed the categorical imperative and revolutionized epistemology.
Kant wrote the Critique of Pure Reason and Groundwork of the Metaphysics of Morals.
Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel was the German idealist philosopher known for dialectical reasoning (thesis-antithesis-synthesis).
Hegel wrote Phenomenology of Spirit and Science of Logic.
Karl Marx developed the theory of historical materialism and class struggle.
Marx wrote Das Kapital and The Communist Manifesto with Friedrich Engels.
David Hume was the Scottish empiricist philosopher known for skepticism about causation and induction.
Hume wrote A Treatise of Human Nature and An Enquiry Concerning Human Understanding.
John Locke was the English philosopher whose ideas on natural rights influenced liberal democracy.
Locke wrote Two Treatises of Government and An Essay Concerning Human Understanding.
Thomas Hobbes argued life without government is 'nasty, brutish, and short'.
Hobbes wrote Leviathan, his masterwork on the social contract.
Baruch Spinoza was the rationalist philosopher who argued God and Nature are the same substance.
Spinoza wrote Ethics and Theological-Political Treatise.
Jean-Jacques Rousseau developed the concept of the general will and influenced the French Revolution.
Rousseau wrote The Social Contract and Emile, or On Education.
Not the philosopher - Henri Rousseau was a different person, a French Post-Impressionist painter known for jungle scenes.
Voltaire was the French Enlightenment thinker known for championing civil liberties and freedom of speech.
Voltaire wrote Candide, a satirical novella mocking Leibnizian optimism.
Voltaire appears in Assassin's Creed Unity in 18th century Paris during the Enlightenment era.
Søren Kierkegaard was the Danish philosopher considered the father of existentialism.
Kierkegaard wrote Fear and Trembling and Either/Or.
Jean-Paul Sartre declared 'existence precedes essence' and championed radical freedom.
Sartre wrote Being and Nothingness and the play No Exit ('Hell is other people').
Albert Camus was the French-Algerian absurdist who explored the meaning of life in an absurd universe.
Camus wrote The Stranger and The Myth of Sisyphus.
Seneca the Younger was a Roman Stoic philosopher and advisor to Emperor Nero.
Seneca lived in the Roman Empire during the pagan era, though Stoicism was becoming compatible with monotheism.
Seneca wrote Letters from a Stoic and numerous tragedies like Medea.
Marcus Aurelius was the Stoic philosopher-emperor whose Meditations remains a bestseller 2000 years later.
Marcus Aurelius was Roman Emperor from 161-180 CE during the pagan era.
Marcus Aurelius ruled the Roman Empire at its territorial peak.
Marcus Aurelius wrote Meditations, personal philosophical writings never meant for publication.
Epictetus was a Stoic philosopher who taught that we can only control our responses, not external events.
Epictetus was born a slave in the Roman Empire around 50 CE during the pagan era.
Epictetus's teachings were recorded by his student Arrian in the Discourses and Enchiridion.
George Orwell was the British author of 1984 and Animal Farm, known for dystopian political fiction.
While his works contain philosophical themes, he's primarily known as a novelist, not a philosopher.
Aldous Huxley was the British author of Brave New World, exploring a dystopia of pleasure and control.
Ray Bradbury was the American author of Fahrenheit 451 and The Martian Chronicles.
Jules Verne was the French 'Father of Science Fiction' who wrote Twenty Thousand Leagues Under the Sea.
H.P. Lovecraft created the Cthulhu Mythos and cosmic horror genre.
H.P. Lovecraft was also a 1960s psychedelic rock band that performed 'White Ship'.
Edgar Allan Poe was the American master of macabre who wrote The Raven and The Tell-Tale Heart.
Not related to Star Wars, though the name sounds like it could be - Poe Dameron is a Star Wars character with a different origin.
Charles Dickens was the Victorian novelist who wrote A Tale of Two Cities and Oliver Twist.
Charles Dickens is a major ally in Assassin's Creed Syndicate, giving missions in Victorian London.
Jane Austen was the English novelist known for Pride and Prejudice and Sense and Sensibility.
Fyodor Dostoevsky was the Russian author of Crime and Punishment and The Brothers Karamazov.
Dostoevsky explored profound philosophical questions about morality, faith, and free will in his novels.
Leo Tolstoy was the Russian author of War and Peace and Anna Karenina.
Tolstoy developed a Christian anarchist philosophy and wrote extensively on ethics and religion.
Mark Twain was the American humorist who wrote The Adventures of Tom Sawyer and Huckleberry Finn.
William Shakespeare was the English playwright who wrote Hamlet, Macbeth, and Romeo and Juliet.
Not a philosopher per se, though his plays contain profound philosophical insights about human nature.
Homer was the ancient Greek poet who composed the Iliad and Odyssey.
Homer's epics are foundational works of Greek mythology and polytheistic religion.
Virgil was the Roman poet who wrote the Aeneid, the epic of Rome's mythological founding.
Virgil lived during the Roman Empire's pagan era and wrote about Roman gods and mythology.
Dante Alighieri wrote the Divine Comedy, the epic journey through Hell, Purgatory, and Paradise.
Dante was a medieval Christian, but he features the Roman pagan poet Virgil as his guide through Hell and Purgatory.
Dante's Death Mask is a key item in Assassin's Creed II, found in his tomb in Florence.
John Milton was the English poet who wrote Paradise Lost, the epic of Satan's fall from Heaven.
Geoffrey Chaucer was the medieval English poet who wrote The Canterbury Tales.
Johann Wolfgang von Goethe wrote Faust and The Sorrows of Young Werther.
Goethe was a polymath who wrote on philosophy, science, and aesthetics.
Lord Byron was the Romantic poet known for Don Juan and Childe Harold's Pilgrimage, whose scandalous life made him the original rock star.
Byron wasn't pagan, but he died fighting for Greek independence and his poetry heavily referenced Greek mythology.
Mary Shelley was the author of Frankenstein, considered the first science fiction novel.
Not a philosopher, though her husband Percy Bysshe Shelley wrote philosophical poetry.
Niccolò Machiavelli was the political philosopher known for ruthlessly pragmatic advice in The Prince.
Machiavelli wrote The Prince and Discourses on Livy.
Machiavelli is a major ally to Ezio in Assassin's Creed Brotherhood, serving as a master Assassin.
Cleopatra VII was the last pharaoh of ancient Egypt, ruling from 51-30 BCE.
Cleopatra is a major character in Assassin's Creed Origins set in Ptolemaic Egypt.
Not a philosopher, though she was highly educated and spoke multiple languages.
